bibl.title: I, Silko, Came to Talmis and Taphis': Interactions between the Peoples beyond the Egyptian Frontier and Rome in Late Antiquity.
bibl.note: Introduction. [The quotation 'I, Silko, came to Talmis and Taphis' comes from O.G.I.S. I, 201.] - The society of Northern Lower Nubia in the fourth and fifth centuries. - Tribal interactions with Romans in the fourth and fifth centuries: An inside perspective. - The Blemmyes in the sixth century. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Inside and Out. Interactions between Rome and the Peoples on the Arabian and Egyptian Frontiers in Late Antiquity

bibl.seg: Jitse H.F. Dijkstra, 'I, Silko, Came to Talmis and Taphis': Interactions between the Peoples beyond the Egyptian Frontier and Rome in Late Antiquity.

Jitse H.F. Dijkstra & Greg Fisher (edd.), Inside and Out. Interactions between Rome and the Peoples on the Arabian and Egyptian Frontiers in Late Antiquity = Late Antique History and Religion. 8 (Leuven, 2014) pp. 299-330, 3 figg.

Introduction. [The quotation 'I, Silko, came to Talmis and Taphis' comes from O.G.I.S. I, 201.] - The society of Northern Lower Nubia in the fourth and fifth centuries. - Tribal interactions with Romans in the fourth and fifth centuries: An inside perspective. - The Blemmyes in the sixth century. - Conclusion.
